definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Some have tried to blow it up or otherwise vandalise it.
sentences.chinese: 有些人想要炸掉它或者是破坏它。

sentences.english: They blew the door off with a small charge of high explosive.
sentences.chinese: 他们装了一小包烈性炸药把门炸掉了。

sentences.english: Don't pump too much air into the tire, otherwise you blow it out.
sentences.chinese: 气别打得太足，否则轮胎会炸掉的。
他们把那座二十年前建的楼炸掉了。

sentences.english: You'll go back to desecrating these people's land, blowing up palm trees?
sentences.chinese: 你要过去玷污这些人的土地，炸掉他们的棕榈树？

sentences.english: They caved in the roof of the building with explosives.
sentences.chinese: 他们用炸药将建筑物的顶部炸掉。

sentences.english: They were carrying homemade bombs to blow up the plane mid-flight .
sentences.chinese: 他们带了自制的炸弹，打算在飞行过程中炸掉飞机。

sentences.english: They've blasted away the rock to build the new road.
sentences.chinese: 他们已炸掉这块岩石以便修一条新的路。

sentences.english: His legs were blown off by an antipersonnel mine, and he died the next day.
sentences.chinese: 他的双腿被地雷炸掉，次日便死去了。

sentences.english: Hidden boulders have been removed by dynamiting.
In order to turn things around, only the most powerful tank consulting blow up.
sentences.chinese: 为了扭转局势，唯有釜底抽薪炸掉威力最大的坦克。

sentences.english: Then iran might pull out its secret stash of nukes and blow up the planet.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗可能会拉掉偷藏起来的核弹，把整个地球炸掉。

sentences.english: And shouldn’t we blow up the bar and replace it with a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们不能炸掉酒吧，再把它换成一个清真寺？

sentences.english: Before he leaved, he would explode the factory.
They're trying to blast away the hill to pave the way for the new highway.
sentences.chinese: 他们试图炸掉这座小山丘为新公路通过。

definition: to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to blow up (demolish with an explosion)
to level/to raze to the ground
to level/to raze to the ground
pillbox (military fortification)/blockhouse/euphemistic way of writing 屌爆[diao3 bao4]
